oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Calif. Food & Agriculture Moves to Ban Psittacines
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: n/a, n/a
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A.F .A. has been advised, through a correspondentin Sacramento, that the State Department of Food andAgriculture is drafting a proposal to prohibit theimportation and possession, in California, of theIndian Ringneck Parakeet, Nan day Conure, and CanaryWing Bee Bee because of evidence of these birdsbreeding in the wild, within the State. Two additionalPsittacine species, Double Yellow Headed Amazon,and the Red Headed Amazon have been sighted in thewild. Although no evidence of their breeding is available,they also may be banned. After the proposal hasbeen finalized, it will be submitted to the Wild LifeImportation Advisory Committee for recommendationor rejection. The A.F.A., through it's representativeon this committee, will gather scientific evidence inthe support of countering this proposal, to protectavicultural interests.
